properties.address: East Sussex County Council, East Sussex BN1 9EW
properties.description: We are open to people of all ages. It is not necessary to be a library member to use our space and facilities. We offer books, newspapers, magazines and board games and puzzles for use in the library. We also have free wifi, public computers and free activities - please ask staff for details. If you want to use one of our pcs or borrow items to take home, you would need to become a library member. If the library is open but unstaffed - Libraries Extra, adults (16 years +) will need a Libraries Extra card to enter. To obtain your free Libraries Extra card visit the library on a staffed day with ID. Children can visit on Libraries Extra days if accompanied by an adult with a Libraries Extra card. https://www.brighton-hove.gov.uk/libraries-leisure-and-arts/libraries/directories/our-libraries-and-their-opening-times

properties.address: Old Boat Corner Community Association Ltd, East Sussex BN1 8GN
properties.description: Old Boat Corner is a home away from home, a place where you can relax, play and make mess, seek help, eat and drink, and enjoy the variety of activities and facilities readily available to all ages and abilities. Our event spaces host a range of private and community-run classes and groups, from mother and baby, soft play and arts and craft, to coffee mornings for the older generation, charitable fundraisers and a variety of sports groups. There is something for everyone. Most importantly the centre is a warm and welcoming place, where you can get information, knowledge, and help within a caring community space.

properties.description: Offering you free food and drink and activities including board games and VR. Esteem will be available Monday to Friday 10am to 6pm throughout the winter for children and adults aged 14 to 26 yrs old. Esteem distribute food donated by Fareshare that young adults can come in to cook for themselves, such as beans on toast, pizza, pasta and omelets. Also running drop in sessions on Monday and Wednesday evenings including hot meals (Monday 6pm to 8pm and Wednesday 6:30pm to 8pm) To find out more about what is on see the live calendar: https://esteem.org.uk/events-calendar/ The office space offers a place for homework and vocational work.

properties.description: The Parish Hall volunteers warmly welcome you every Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday morning 10am to 12 noon (and 3pm to 5pm on Wednesday from 8th January 2025). There will be light refreshments including tea, coffee, toast, cakes, biscuits. Activities and warm packs provided. A community library and games exchange shelf will be accessible for borrowing and contributions, promoting shared gaming experiences among attendees. Additionally, there will be Christmas and February half-term activities for families. For more information keep an eye on our Facebook page for more details: https://www.facebook.com/lancingparishcouncil/?locale=en_GB Everyone is welcome!

Additionally, there will be Christmas and February half-term activities for families. properties.address: Palmeira Square, St John's Road, Hove, BN3 2FL
properties.description: The Hop 50+ is a community space and café which offers a range of activities and social opportunities for people aged 50+. It supports customers to improve their health and wellbeing, to learn new skills. It is a place where people can enjoy good food and company.Find out more about what activities are available at The Hop 50+.
properties.title: The Hop 50+

properties.address: The Jubilee Library Jubilee Street, Brighton, BN1 1GE
properties.description: The Leward Centre is a safe and inspiring place for the LGBTQ+ communities and their friends.
properties.title: The Ledward Centre

properties.address: The Parish Church of St Nicholas, Saltdean Vale, Saltdean, BN2 8HA
properties.description: A dedicated warm space at the back of the church with a large sofa, coffee table, blankets and books.Tea and coffee is available free of charge.There are sometimes church services and a specific 'stay and play' for children and parents on a Thursday.
properties.title: The Parish Church of St Nicholas

properties.address: The Salvation Army, 159 Sackville Road, Hove, BN3 3HD
properties.description: The Salvation Army provides board games, crafts, a jigsaw, spaces to chat, and a child friendly corner with toys.The Lunch Club runs on a Wednesday. This is a low-cost meal (£3.50 main, £1.50 dessert, free tea and coffee) with a quiz or other activity at the end.There are two sessions called ‘Open House’ on Tuesdays and Fridays between 10am and midday. Both provide free tea/coffee/biscuits.There is also have a seating area in the Salvation Army charity shop. The shop is open 9:30am to 4:00pm Monday to Friday. A drinks machine (£1 per drink) available.
properties.title: The Salvation Army
